alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Coastal Kenedy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Jim Hogg; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 21 at 8:02AM CST until January 21 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON CST TODAY... ...WINTER STORM WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Freezing rain and sleet occurring. Very cold wind chills expected. The ice will result in very slippery conditions on sidewalks, roads and bridges, including during the morning commute. Additional ice accumulations of a light glaze are expected. Expect wind chills to range from 20 to 25 degrees. * WHERE...Portions of Deep South Texas. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 12 PM today. For the Wind Chill Advisory, now to 12 PM this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The cold wind chills will cause frostbite in as little as 30 minutes to exposed skin.
info.instruction: A Winter Weather Advisory means that periods of freezing rain will cause travel difficulties. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and the wind will combine to create low wind chills. Frost bite and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken. Make sure you wear a hat and gloves.
